overview: Obtaining a citizenship certificate is a multi-step process that requires visiting your local ward office and district administration office. The entire process typically takes 10-15 days.
overviewNepali: नागरिकता प्रमाणपत्र प्राप्त गर्न तपाईंले आफ्नो स्थानीय वडा कार्यालय र जिल्ला प्रशासन कार्यालयमा जानु पर्छ। सम्पूर्ण प्रक्रिया सामान्यतया १०-१५ दिन लाग्छ।
stepByStepGuide: Collect your birth certificate and parents' citizenship photocopies
Visit your local ward office during working hours
Fill out the recommendation form at the ward office
Pay NPR 100 fee and obtain recommendation letter
Visit the District Administration Office with all documents
Fill out the citizenship application form (Form 1)
Submit documents and pay NPR 500 fee
Receive acknowledgment receipt with collection date
Return to DAO on specified date to collect certificate
importantNotes: Applicant must be at least 16 years old
Both parents must be Nepali citizens for citizenship by descent
Late registration of birth may require additional documentation
Bring original documents for verification, photocopies will be submitted
Friday office hours are shorter (closes at 3 PM)
Public holidays and Saturdays are closed

faqs.question: What if my birth registration was delayed?
faqs.answer: You need to obtain a late birth registration certificate from the ward office first, with supporting documents like school certificates or immunization cards.

faqs.question: Can I apply if one parent is not a Nepali citizen?
faqs.answer: If born before 2006, you can get citizenship if either parent is Nepali. If born after 2006, both parents must be Nepali for citizenship by descent.

faqs.question: How long is the citizenship certificate valid?
faqs.answer: The citizenship certificate is valid for lifetime and does not require renewal.

faqs.question: What if I lose my citizenship certificate?
faqs.answer: You can apply for a duplicate citizenship certificate at the same DAO with a police complaint report and newspaper publication.

commonIssues.issue: Ward office refuses to provide recommendation
commonIssues.solution: Ensure all documents are complete. If still refused, you can file a complaint with the ward chairperson or municipality office.
Visit the DAO with your acknowledgment receipt and politely inquire about the status. You can escalate to the Chief District Officer if necessary.

commonIssues.issue: Parents' citizenship numbers don't match records
commonIssues.solution: Bring parents to the DAO with their original citizenship certificates for verification and record correction.
